docblock.description: User accounts include functions for the RMS API.
docblock.long-description: Allows read and write access to user accounts via PHP function calls. Used throughout RMS and within the RMS API.

docblock.description: Generate a random 16 character string for salting passwords.
Check if the given array has all of the necessary fields to create a new user account.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If the given array has all of the necessary fields to create a new user account

docblock.description: Get the enum types for user accounts in an array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing the enum types for users

docblock.description: Get an array of all the user accounts in the system, or null if none exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of all the user accounts in the system, or null if none exist

docblock.description: Get the user array for the user with the given ID, or null if none exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the user's SQL entry or null if none exist

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the user's SQL entry or null if none exist

docblock.long-description: Any errors are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The email address of the user

tag.name: return
tag.description: An error message or null if the create was sucessful

docblock.description: Update a user account with the given information inside of the array.
docblock.long-description: The array should be indexed by the SQL column names. The ID field must be contained inside of the array with the index 'id'. Any errors are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the fields to update including the user ID number

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the update was sucessful

docblock.description: Delete the user array for the user with the given ID.
docblock.long-description: Any errors are returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the delete was sucessful

docblock.description: Check for valid authorization.
docblock.long-description: If the RMS-Use-Session HTTP header is set to true, then session information will be used for authorization. If this is not the case, then the HTTP Authentication header is used to authenticate.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The authenticated user or null if none exist

docblock.description: Get the HTML for an editor used to create or edit the given user account entry.
docblock.long-description: If this is not an edit, null can be given as the ID. An invalid ID is the same as giving a null ID.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the ID of the user account to edit, or null if a new entry is being made

tag.name: return
tag.description: A string containing the HTML of the editor

docblock.description: User account script for the RMS API.
docblock.long-description: Allows read and write access to user accounts via the RMS API.

docblock.description: Users API script.
docblock.long-description:
Currently, this level of the API contains no useful functions.

Returns a bad request response.

docblock.description: Common include functions for the RMS API.
docblock.long-description: A set of useful functions used within the RMS API.

docblock.description: Creates a default 404 state in an array.
docblock.long-description: This includes a 'false' in the 'ok' element, the given error message in the 'msg' element, and null in the 'data' element. The header is also changed to the 404 state.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The message to put in the array

docblock.description: Creates a default 401 state in an array.
docblock.long-description: This includes a 'false' in the 'ok' element, 'Insufficient authorization.' in the 'msg' element, and null in the 'data' element. The header is also changed to the 401 state.

docblock.description: Creates a default 200 state in an array.
docblock.long-description: This includes a 'true' in the 'ok' element, 'Success.' in the 'msg' element, and $data in the 'data' element. The header is also changed to the 200 state.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data to place in the 'data' element of the array

docblock.description: Get the enum types for the given column in the given table in an array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of the MySQL table

tag.name: param
tag.description: the column name inside of the given table

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array containing the enum types for the given column in the given table

docblock.description: Get the current timestamp from the MySQL server.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The current timestamp from the MySQL server

docblock.description: Configration script for the RMS API.
docblock.long-description: Allows read and write access to site settings and configuration. Proper authentication is required. Alternatively, if the 'inc/confic.inc.php' file is missing, no authentication is required and only the default POST request will be accepted. This allows for initial site setup.

docblock.description: The simple_nav2d interface is an interface implementation that allows for three widget types: a MJPEG canvas widget, a nav2d widget, and a keyboard teleop widget.
docblock.long-description: One camera feed, one nav2d widget, and one keyboard widget are required for this interface to load.

docblock.description: Generate the HTML for the interface.
docblock.long-description: All HTML is echoed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated robot_environment object for this interface

docblock.description: A basic interface to display 1 or more MJPEG streams and basic keyboard teleoperation control.
Generate the HTML for the interface.
docblock.long-description: All HTML is echoed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The associated robot_environment object for this interface

docblock.description: A PHP object to store information useful when generating an interface.
The robot_environment class contains useful functions for gaining access to useful information such as widget lists, ROS.JS connections, etc.
The user account SQL array for the current user.
The environment SQL array for the current environment.
The interface SQL array for the current interface.
The array of arrays of SQL widget entries.
docblock.long-description: The first array is indexed by widget name. The inner array is indexed only by numbers.

docblock.description: The experiment SQL entry for any valid experiments found for the given user at this time.
docblock.long-description: This will be set to null if such an experiment does not exist.

docblock.description: Checks if the current user is authorized for this interface/environment.
docblock.long-description: An authorized user is either an admin or a regular user how has a valid experiment session now.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Create common parts of the HTML head section.
docblock.long-description: This includes metadata, common RMS CSS files, all widget and RMS Javascript files, and a custom style.css class if it exists in the interface. All HTML will be echoed.

docblock.description: Create common parts of the HTML head section for a study session.
docblock.long-description: If the current user has a valid experiment at this time, this function will create three JavaScript global variables. The first, _EXPID, contains the experiment ID number for this user. The second, _TIME, is the time remaining in microseconds remaining in their session at the time the page was loaded. The final, _END, is the interval ID for the JavaScript time user to indicate the session is over. This will go off in _TIME microseconds and will call a function called 'endStudy' if one exists. All HTML will be echoed and should be placed in the HEAD section. If no valid experiment is found for this user, nothing will be echoed.

docblock.description: Create the HTML to create a connection to ROS using ros.js.
docblock.long-description: This will be wrapped in its own

docblock.description: Robot environments API script.
docblock.long-description: Allows read and write access to robot environments. This includes things like pairings between interfaces and environments. Used throughout RMS and within the RMS API.

docblock.description: Nav2D API script.
docblock.long-description: This allows the creation of Nav2D widgets using RMS SQL entires. This is used throughout interface creation.

docblock.description: Create the Javascript and HTML needed for a given Nav2D widget.
docblock.long-description: The Javascript will be wrapped in its own

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL entry for the navigation we are creating (this can be easily found in the interface's robot_environment object)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The image to use instead of the raw map or null if no image is being used (defual is null)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of a JavaScript function that will be called once the widget is created or null if no callback is being used (defual is null)

tag.name: return
tag.description: The HTML to create the map object

docblock.description: Default Nav2D script.

Currently, this level of the API contains no useful functions.

Returns a bad request response.

docblock.description: Keyboard Teleop API script.
docblock.long-description: This allows the creation of Keyboard Teleop widgets using RMS SQL entires. This is used throughout interface creation.

docblock.description: Create the HTML and Javascript needed for a keyboard telop widget with an associated speed slider.
docblock.long-description: This creates two divs with IDs of speed-label and speed-slider. Custom CSS can be used to change the appearance of these. Javascript is also created to bind the keyboard and link the slider. This should be placed somewhere in your HTML BODY section. Note that this returns the HTML, you will need to echo it in the appropriate spot.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL entry for the teleop we are creating (this can be easily found in the interface's robot_environment object)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of a JavaScript function that will be called once the widget is created or null if no callback is being used (default is null)

tag.name: return
tag.description: The HTML to create the widget and the slider

docblock.description: Default Keyboard Teleop script.
docblock.long-description:
Currently, this level of the API contains no useful functions.

Returns a bad request response.

docblock.description: Widget include functions for the RMS API.

tag.description: An array of the widget's instances or null if none exist

docblock.description: Create a widget instance with the given information.
docblock.long-description: The widget ID number should be included in the array. Any errors are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The values for the widget creation

tag.name: return
tag.description: An error message or null if the create was sucessful

docblock.description: Update a widget with the given information inside of the array.
docblock.long-description: The array should be indexed by the SQL column names. The ID field must be contained inside of the array with the index 'id'. Any errors are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the fields to update including the widget ID number

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the update was sucessful

docblock.description: Update a widget instance with the given information inside of the array.
docblock.long-description: The array should be indexed by the SQL column names. The ID field must be contained inside of the array with the index 'id' for the instance ID and index 'widgetid` for the widget's ID. Any errors are returned.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the fields to update including the widget ID numbers

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the update was sucessful

docblock.description: Delete the widget array for the widget with the given ID.
docblock.long-description: Any errors are returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the delete was sucessful

docblock.long-description: Any errors are returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: an error message or null if the delete was sucessful

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the unused widget directory scripts or null if none exist

docblock.description: Get an array of all the unused widget SQL tables or null if none exist.
docblock.long-description: A valid table is any table with an 'envid' field, and a 'label' field.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of the unused widget SQL tables or null if none exist

docblock.description: Get the HTML for an editor used to create or edit the given widget entry.

docblock.description: Create the HTML and Javascript needed to create a multi-stream MJPEG canvas with the given information.
docblock.long-description: This will create an HTML5 canvas element to render on and thus should be placed in the BODY section of the HTML. Note that this returns the HTML, you will need to echo it in the appropriate spot.

tag.description: The index of the default stream (0 by default)

Connection script for connecting to a robot environment with a given interface.
docblock.long-description: If the logged in user is an admin, then all interface and environment options are available. If this is just a regular user, then only their scheduled study environments will be displayed.

docblock.description: Developer API index page.
docblock.long-description: This page provides links to the REST, PHP, and JavaScript APIs.

docblock.description: Main user menu page for RMS.
docblock.long-description: If the logged in user is an admin, then all interface and environment options are available. If this is just a regular user, then only their scheduled study environments will be displayed.

docblock.long-description: The main study admin panel allows read/write access to study SQL tables via a GUI.

docblock.long-description: Currently, the user account page is a placeholder page.

docblock.description: Main setup form for RMS.
docblock.long-description: The setup form can only be run if the 'inc/config.inc.php' file is missing.

docblock.description: Main index page for RMS.
docblock.long-description: The index page will load either the default hompage, or the content page specified in the URL.

docblock.description: RMS Site Settings and Configuration
docblock.long-description: Contains the site settings and configurations for the RMS. This file is auto-generated and should not be edited by hand.

docblock.description: Include functions for the HTML BODY section of the RMS.
docblock.long-description: Provides several common functions to generate the HTML for the BODY section of the RMS HTML. Examples include the header, menu, and footer.

docblock.description: A function to echo the HTML for the main header based on the given user and page name.
docblock.long-description: If the user is an admin, the admin menus will be shown.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the user SQL array for the current user (or null if none)

tag.name: param
tag.description: the relative path to the base RMS directory

docblock.long-description: This includes metadata, common CSS and Javascript files, and the Google Analytics code if it exists.
